title: Automatically fill in credit card and payment method data on Web forms
summary: Manage credit card autofill settings in Firefox version 81 and above.
html:
Note: The credit card autofill feature is available to users in all countries starting with Firefox 135 and above.

Firefox lets you automatically fill in your saved information for credit cardspayment methods, which includes credit and debit cards, on Web forms (for example, when you're ordering something online). As a precaution, your CVV number is not saved. You can also choose to password protect your credit cardpayment method data for an additional layer of protection. Follow these steps to learn how to manage this feature.

Table of Contents

  • 1 Turn credit card autofill on or off
    • 1.1 Advanced: Disable credit card autofill in about:config
  • 2 Turn payment methods autofill on or off
  • 3 Require authentication for autofill
    • 3.1 What if I don't have an OS password?
  • 4 Edit your saved credit cards
  • 5 Edit your saved payment methods

Turn credit card autofill on or off

This feature is recommended for private computers only.
  1. In the Menu bar at the top of the screen, click Firefox and then select Preferences or Settings, depending on your macOS version.Click the menu button and select Settings.
  2. Click the Privacy & Security panel and scroll down to the Forms and Autofill section.
  3. Click the checkbox next to Autofill credit cards to turn it on, or uncheck the box to turn it off.

Advanced: Disable credit card autofill in about:config

This feature can also be disabled manually by modifying the following preferences via the Configuration Editor (about:config) to false and then restarting Firefox:

Warning: These instructions are for experienced Firefox users. Changing settings in the Configuration Editor (about:config) can have serious effects on your browserâ€™s stability, security and performance.
Only proceed if you are comfortable with advanced settings and understand the potential impacts.
extensions.formautofill.creditCards.enabled
extensions.formautofill.creditCards.available

Turn payment methods autofill on or off

This feature is recommended for private computers only.
  1. In the Menu bar at the top of the screen, click Firefox and then select Preferences or Settings, depending on your macOS version.Click the menu button and select Settings.
  2. Click the Privacy & Security panel and scroll down to the Autofill section.
  3. Click the checkbox next to Save and fill payment methods to turn it on, or uncheck the box to turn it off.

Require authentication for autofill

To add further protection, you can select to require authentication before autofilling the credit card information. This requires your operating system password (or authenticate using your fingerprint, face, or voice login, if enabled) this is usually the password used to unlock your computer. Please note, this is not your Mozilla account password.

  1. In the Menu bar at the top of the screen, click Firefox and then select Preferences or Settings, depending on your macOS version.Click the menu button and select Settings.
  2. Click the Privacy & Security panel and scroll down to the Forms and Autofill section.
  3. Click the checkbox next to Require macOSWindowsLinux authentication to autofill, view, or edit stored credit cards to turn it on, or uncheck the box to turn it off.
  1. In the Menu bar at the top of the screen, click Firefox and then select Preferences or Settings, depending on your macOS version.Click the menu button and select Settings.
  2. Click the Privacy & Security panel and scroll down to the Autofill section.
  3. Click the checkbox next to Require macOSWindowsLinux authentication to fill and edit payment methods to turn it on, or uncheck the box to turn it off.

What if I don't have an OS password?

  • Windows: If you aren't using a Windows password, you will not be prompted to enter it.
  • macOS: If you don't have a password, click the OK twice to continue. Note: This is a known issue and will be fixed in a future update.

Edit your saved credit cards

Use this setting to add, remove or change saved credit card data in Firefox.

  1. In the Menu bar at the top of the screen, click Firefox and then select Preferences or Settings, depending on your macOS version.Click the menu button and select Settings.
  2. Click the Privacy & Security panel and scroll down to the Forms and Autofill section.
  3. Click the Saved Credit Cardsâ€¦ button.
  4. Choose one of the following:
    • Addâ€¦: Enter a new credit card using this button.
    • Editâ€¦: Select the credit card you want to change, then click Edit to change it.
    • Remove: Select the credit card you want to delete, then click Remove.
  5. Click the âœ• to save your changes and close the window.

Edit your saved payment methods

Use this setting to add, remove or change saved payment method data in Firefox.

  1. In the Menu bar at the top of the screen, click Firefox and then select Preferences or Settings, depending on your macOS version.Click the menu button and select Settings.
  2. Click the Privacy & Security panel and scroll down to the Autofill section.
  3. Click the Saved payment methods button.
  4. Choose one of the following:
    • Addâ€¦: Enter a new payment method using this button.
    • Editâ€¦: Select the payment method you want to change, then click Edit to change it.
    • Remove: Select the credit card you want to delete, then click Remove.
  5. Click the âœ• to save your changes and close the window.
